byline.contributor: Sophia Kishkovsky, Alexandra Odynova, and Nikolay Khalip contributed reporting from Moscow.

abstract: Russia’s domestic tourism industry enjoys upswing due to political pressures over Ukrainian crisis, rise in nationalism and decline in ruble’s value, all factors in decision by many Russians to skip foreign holidays and vacation instead in motherland.
lead_paragraph: Since the ruble’s fall late last year put foreign vacations out of reach of many in the middle class, more Russians are choosing to vacation at home.

headline.main: With Ruble’s Decline, Russian Tourists Gain Appreciation for the Motherland
headline.print_headline: Russian Tourists Gain Appreciation for the Motherland

snippet: Since the ruble’s fall late last year put foreign vacations out of reach of many in the middle class, more Russians are choosing to vacation at home.
